events.originalText: Burmese military and police forces killed at least 65 civilians during the Hlaingthaya massacre in Yangon, Myanmar, including those protesting the 2021 Myanmar coup d'état.
events.subtitle: Tatmadaw
events.headline: 65 civilians killed in Hlaingthaya massacre in Yangon, Myanmar

events.originalText: China defeated Vietnam in a naval battle as the former attempted to establish oceanographic observation posts on the Spratly Islands.
events.subtitle: Johnson South Reef Skirmish
events.headline: China defeats Vietnam in naval battle over Spratly Islands

events.originalText: Gerry Adams, leader of Sinn Féin, was seriously wounded in an assassination attempt by Ulster Freedom Fighters in central Belfast, Northern Ireland.
events.subtitle: Gerry Adams
events.headline: Sinn Féin leader Gerry Adams wounded in assassination attempt

events.originalText: Vietnam War: After having been captured by North Vietnamese forces five and a half years earlier, U.S. Navy pilot John McCain was released with 108 other prisoners of war.
events.subtitle: Vietnam War
events.headline: U.S. Navy pilot John McCain released after 5 years as POW

events.originalText: Italian publisher Giangiacomo Feltrinelli, known for his translation of Boris Pasternak's novel Doctor Zhivago after it had been smuggled out of the Soviet Union, died in an explosion.
events.subtitle: Giangiacomo Feltrinelli
events.headline: Italian publisher Giangiacomo Feltrinelli dies in explosion

events.originalText: Edward M. Burke, the longest-serving alderman in the history of the Chicago City Council, was sworn into office.
events.subtitle: Edward M. Burke
events.headline: Edward M. Burke sworn in as longest-serving alderman in Chicago

events.originalText: The Royal Air Force first used the Grand Slam, a 22,000 lb (10,000 kg) earthquake bomb, on a strategic railway viaduct in Bielefeld, Germany.
events.subtitle: Royal Air Force
events.headline: Royal Air Force uses Grand Slam bomb on railway viaduct in Bielefeld

events.originalText: Alam Ara, the first Indian sound film, premiered at the Majestic Cinema in Bombay.
events.subtitle: Alam Ara
events.headline: First Indian sound film Alam Ara premieres in Bombay

events.originalText: The Mikado, Gilbert and Sullivan's most frequently performed Savoy opera, debuted at the Savoy Theatre in London.
events.subtitle: The Mikado
events.headline: Gilbert and Sullivan's The Mikado debuts at Savoy Theatre in London

events.originalText: Royal Navy Admiral John Byng was executed by firing squad for failing to "do his utmost" during the Battle of Minorca at the start of the Seven Years' War.
events.subtitle: Royal Navy
events.headline: Royal Navy Admiral John Byng executed for Battle of Minorca failure

events.originalText: Japanese invasions of Korea: A force of 3,000 Korean soldiers successfully defended Haengju Fortress against 30,000 Japanese invaders.
events.subtitle: Japanese invasions of Korea (1592–1598)
events.headline: Korean soldiers defend Haengju Fortress against Japanese invaders

events.originalText: Catherine Cornaro (pictured), Queen of Cyprus, was forced to abdicate and sell the administration of the island to the Republic of Venice.
events.subtitle: Catherine Cornaro
events.headline: Queen of Cyprus Catherine Cornaro forced to abdicate to Venice

events.originalText: On Eid al-Fitr, the citizens of Granada stormed palaces in the city, deposing Sultan Muhammad III and placing his half-brother Nasr on the throne.
events.subtitle: Eid al-Fitr
events.headline: Granada citizens depose Sultan Muhammad III on Eid al-Fitr
